content:
At Slavic Media, we love working on projects that have meaning and contribute to something good. Our collaboration with Huset Fundament was one of those projects, especially because Slavic Media’s beginnings are rooted here.

Our partnership began in February 2023, and since then, we’ve completed over 25 photo sessions and two video shoots. We focused on capturing authentic moments – from live concerts in the iconic Pitstop venue to workshops where local artists shared their skills, like leather crafting, ceramics, or portrait photography. Each time, we faced the challenge of adapting to different environments and capturing the true spirit of these events.

Our work enhanced the visitor experience by providing them with photos of their involvement at Huset Fundament, creating a collection for crowdfunding campaigns, and attracting more artists to this unique community. For us, it wasn’t just work, but a real connection with artists, creators, and their stories.

Working in the theatre and capturing artistic works, especially autobiographical ones, is always a rewarding challenge. We are passionate about bringing unique stories to life through visual media, and this collaboration was truly inspiring. We look forward to documenting more new artistic visions!
title: The creative community in Kolding Kommune is alive

content:
Kim Kim
Adam S.

We had the unique opportunity to be part of the “Friskabe” performance, directed by the talented Kim Kim at Sort/Hvid Theatre in Copenhagen earlier this summer. After our previous collaboration at the Roskilde Festival, Kim invited us to capture and document this piece.

Friskabte
Adam S.

“Friskabe” is a fascinating adaptation of the book “The Ship”, where Kim masterfully connects his personal experiences with the story, performing a profound and unique dimension. Together with singer Henriette Sennenvaldt from the band ‌UNDER BYEN, they created a captivating musical and visual atmosphere that our cameras enthusiastically captured.

Our visual documentation was supported by unique props: a fountain made of wine glasses, a giant plaster cake (referring to the famous Danish artist Michael Kvium), an enormous screen projection, a sandbox, a swing, and more.

Friskabte
Adam S.

Working in the theatre and capturing artistic works, especially autobiographical ones, is always a rewarding challenge. We are passionate about bringing unique stories to life through visual media, and this collaboration was truly inspiring. We look forward to documenting more new artistic visions!

Thanks to the sales & communication manager Maja for the opportunity to be part of it, and to Kim for another great collaboration!
title: Transformation of Literature into a Musical Drama

content:
Adam and Marcel on Åland
Adam S.

The Åland Islands are autonomously demilitarized territories under Finnish jurisdiction. They have their own government, flag, and historical heritage and are exempt from Finnish conscription. The Åland Islands are entirely Swedish-speaking, adding a unique cultural layer to the trip.

Planning this expedition to the land of ål (eel) had been a goal since arriving in Finland. In mid-October 2022, I traveled with my friend Andreas from Dalarna, and we embarked from Turku to explore the unique landscape and culture.

<iframe class='reveal' src='https://www.google.com/maps/embed?pb=!1m18!1m12!1m3!1d1016484.2364314073!2d18.892657251198028!3d60.158868376358036!2m3!1f0!2f0!3f0!3m2!1i1024!2i768!4f13.1!3m3!1m2!1s0x468ae468c4e1eb19%3A0xcd43f68373428eed!2s%C3%85land%20Islands!5e0!3m2!1sen!2scz!4v1730814474805!5m2!1sen!2scz' allowfullscreen='' loading='lazy' referrerpolicy='no-referrer-when-downgrade'></iframe>

Our adventure took us through hundreds of skerries in the Archipelago Sea, an area with approximately 8300 square kilometers of around 50,000 archipelagos and rocky islands, one of the most extensive in the world.

Wind turbines on Archipelago skerries.
Adam S.
Meeting Marcel from Slovakia in Mariehamn, we embarked northward, following a rhythm of breaks to recharge as we explored the Åland landscapes.

Andreas hiking with makeshift pole
Adam S.
Camping along Lake Långsjön and adjusting to unforeseen challenges such as off-season ferry schedules, we adapted by hitchhiking, reaching places like Djupviksgrottan cave with local help.

Hitchhiking along Åland roads
Adam S.
We were warmly welcomed by locals, like Karolina, who provided hospitality and local insights, strengthening our connection to Åland’s community spirit.

Contemporary cavemans
Adam S.
Following local tips, we explored historic sites on Prästo, encountering ancient graves and scenic landscapes, adding to our understanding of Åland’s layered history.

Ancient graves on Prästo
Adam S.
After an evening of fishing and swimming, we concluded our journey in Mariehamn, reflecting on the kindness we experienced and the beauty of Åland’s wilderness.

Video Content

  • Åland I.
  • Åland II.
  • Åland III.
title: Expedition to the Åland Islands

content:
WWII bunker on Blåvand beach
Adam S.

On the 12th of April, I woke up early and packed a backpack with lunch before heading to the Kolding train station. I took a train to Oksbøl, located near Blåvand, Denmark's westernmost city. My plan was to visit the Blåvand Lighthouse, a 35-minute walk from the bus station. Blåvand was hosting a festival, and the main road through the city was filled with cars with Danish and German license plates.

<iframe class='reveal' src='https://www.google.com/maps/embed?pb=!1m18!1m12!1m3!1d230514.95742332027!2d7.9101174183203184!3d55.591246469354545!2m3!1f0!2f0!3f0!3m2!1i1024!2i768!4f13.1!3m3!1m2!1s0x464ac242a22f1f7f%3A0x4e7f7a444252009a!2sBl%C3%A5vandshuk%20Fyr!5e0!3m2!1sen!2scz!4v1730815918307!5m2!1sen!2scz' allowfullscreen='' loading='lazy' referrerpolicy='no-referrer-when-downgrade'></iframe>

I stopped at a local shop to buy a shrimp salad from a bakery before walking through Blåvand’s small center and reaching an area with summer houses surrounded by pine trees. Nearing the shore, vacation homes gave way to standalone houses built in dunes just meters from the sea.

Dunes near Blåvand’s shore
Adam S.

According to my navigation app, I had about 20 minutes left to reach the North Sea shore. I walked along Denmark's west coast, following the border with Germany to the south, up to the Blåvandshuk headland.

Bunker sinking into the sand with horse-themed graffiti
Adam S.
These WWII bunkers, built as part of the Atlantic Wall, were a striking reminder of the past. I used Polycam to scan and capture these bunkers in 3D.

3D scan of an Atlantic Wall bunker from WWII
Adam S.
The app's ease of use made it ideal for capturing these historic relics. As I walked, I saw bunkers covered in graffiti, shaped like horses and giraffes.

Hilly dunes near Blåvand lighthouse
Adam S.
I eventually reached the lighthouse, climbed to the top, and enjoyed a surreal view of rolling dunes, dense with various grasses. The landscape reminded me of Scarif from the Star Wars universe.

Panoramic view from Blåvand lighthouse
Adam S.
The visit to Blåvand was memorable, filled with unique scenes of bunkers, vast dunes, and the rugged coastline. For those interested, nearby attractions include Bjarke Ingels’s Tirpitz Museum.
title: 3D scanning a WWII bunker on iPhone

content:
Pastel green abandoned house in Vaasa
Adam S.

I borrowed the concept of House Hunting from the inspiring photographer Todd Hido. While our goals differ, I aimed to blend Urbex and Scandinavian architecture to capture the essence of abandoned buildings, much like Hido’s work.

Facade of the Scandinavian-style abandoned house
Adam S.

In past attempts to emulate Hido's style with lonely constructions in Czechia and Denmark, I came close but never achieved the haunting atmosphere he captures. This exploration in Vaasa felt like my closest attempt yet.

<iframe src='https://www.google.com/maps/embed?pb=!1m18!1m12!1m3!1d231301.88088178815!2d21.63541275!3d63.0691805!2m3!1f0!2f0!3f0!3m2!1i1024!2i768!4f13.1!3m3!1m2!1s0x467d603e623ab243%3A0x1e1d7faa61aa800e!2sVaasa%2C%20Finland!5e0!3m2!1sen!2scz!4v1730816829855!5m2!1sen!2scz' allowfullscreen='' loading='lazy' referrerpolicy='no-referrer-when-downgrade'></iframe>

During a walk in the Palosaari neighborhood of Vaasa, I spotted a charming pastel green family house with broken windows and a damaged entrance staircase, unmistakably uninhabited and perfect for my project.

An empty room lit by the morning sun
Adam S.

After contacting the city planning department, I learned that the building was set for demolition. While saving it through the Cheap Old Houses initiative wasn’t feasible, the Ostrobothnian Museum may be consulted due to its age and historical value.

Narrow wooden staircase leading upstairs
Adam S.

With the owner's permission, my friend and fellow photographer Samuli and I set out to photograph the house's interior at sunrise. We captured the walls with bleached spots from once-hanging frames and paintings, documenting its charm before its potential demolition.

Faded spots on walls hinting at previous frames
Adam S.
Despite the impending demolition, this exploration allowed us to document a piece of history through our photography, capturing the building's beauty and nostalgia one last time.
title: Todd Hido's House Hunting in Scandinavian style

content:
Autumnal mire in Västerbotten, Sweden
Adam S.

As autumn set in, I joined an exchange program at Vaasan Ylipsto in Finland, which led me to Västerbotten, Sweden, invited by my classmate Andreas. We stayed with Joakim, a member of the native Sámi people, in his family’s heritage-rich home.

<iframe src='https://www.google.com/maps/embed?pb=!1m18!1m12!1m3!1d2995140.5517295063!2d11.894485941672087!3d65.19068958749016!2m3!1f0!2f0!3f0!3m2!1i1024!2i768!4f13.1!3m3!1m2!1s0x4670d07adf8a6861%3A0x2d7256c45bdee2dd!2s912%2097%20Vasterbotten%2C%20Sweden!5e0!3m2!1sen!2scz!4v1730817345453!5m2!1sen!2scz' allowfullscreen='' loading='lazy' referrerpolicy='no-referrer-when-downgrade'></iframe>

Our first night was spent forest camping, taking advantage of Sweden's Everyman's Right to roam and camp in nature. We set up a minimal shelter under the stars, surrounded by berries and young pine forest.

Swedish pine forest
Adam S.
During our stay, we also attended a 90-minute introduction to Brazilian jiu-jitsu at Umeå Kampcenter. Later, Joakim hosted a sparring session, sharing his own martial arts experience.

The following day was devoted to bushcraft and exploring the countryside near Bullmark. With gear in hand, we ventured into the mixed woods and set up camp by a mire lake. Our site, shielded by towering trees, was marked for hunters’ visibility, ensuring safety during hunting season.

Our mire-camp site in the Västerbotten countryside
Adam S.

Settling into camp as rain clouds rolled in, I reflected on the raw power of nature and its timeless cycles. The shifting weather transformed the landscape, emphasizing the primal, unyielding forces that shape our world.

Joakim at the campsite
Adam S.

That evening, a faint aurora appeared above the mire. It was a moment of calm and a reminder of nature’s enduring beauty. The northern lights highlighted our experience, bringing our trip full circle.

Original Sámi knives handcrafted by Joakim
Adam S.

The next day, we returned to Bullmark, spending our last hours packing and relaxing before heading back to Finland. The trip had been a powerful encounter with both nature and the cultural heritage of Västerbotten.
title: Bushcrafting in Swedish Västerbotten

content: Recently, my friend Marcel and I embarked on a bike trip from Flensburg in Germany to Skagen in Denmark along the Jutland peninsula's west coast. It was an unforgettable journey.

We traveled over 570 km in 10 days along the Danish national cycle route 1, also known as Vestkystruten, capturing stunning views of Denmark. Our route included nights in public shelters and forests, swimming in the chilly North Sea, and exploring inland fjords.

<iframe src='https://www.google.com/maps/embed?pb=!1m18!1m12!1m3!1d2272668.8742977376!2d8.903950990226493!3d56.20199148672109!2m3!1f0!2f0!3f0!3m2!1i1024!2i768!4f13.1!3m3!1m2!1s0x464b27b6ee945ffb%3A0x528743d0c3e092cd!2sDenmark!5e0!3m2!1sen!2scz!4v1730818049913!5m2!1sen!2scz' allowfullscreen='' loading='lazy' referrerpolicy='no-referrer-when-downgrade'></iframe>
From coastal vistas to quaint towns, the journey had it all. Our destination, Skagen, offered a unique sight where the North Sea meets the Baltic Sea.
title: How we cycled Denmark from south to north
